answer

Class WarehouseTransactions

  • java.lang.Object
    • answer.WarehouseTransactions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transactions

    public class WarehouseTransactions
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transactions
    A solution to the "warehouse transactions" part of INB370 Assignment 1.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    CAB302

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WarehouseTransactions(java.lang.Integer warehouseCapacity, java.lang.Integer jobDuration, WarehouseLedger cleanLedger)
      Define the transactions you can perform while managing a warehouse of items awaiting retail sale.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean insolvent()
      Returns true if the business is currently insolvent, i.e., if the cash reserve is negative.
      boolean jobDone()
      Returns true if the business simulation has ended because the number of days originally allocated for the job (when this class was constructed) has been exceeded.
      boolean orderUnfulfilled()
      Returns true if the last order processed, using methods sellStock or restockAndSellStock, was not fulfilled, i.e., if more items were ordered than were in stock at the time.
      void restockAndSellStock(java.lang.Integer todaysOrder)
      Complete a day's transactions by (1) restocking the warehouse to capacity, (2) selling the ordered number of items, and (3) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order.
      void sellStock(java.lang.Integer todaysOrder)
      Complete a day's transactions by (1) selling the ordered number of items, and (2) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • WarehouseTransactions

        public WarehouseTransactions(java.lang.Integer warehouseCapacity,
                             java.lang.Integer jobDuration,
                             WarehouseLedger cleanLedger)
                      throws WarehouseException
        Define the transactions you can perform while managing a warehouse of items awaiting retail sale.
        Parameters:
        warehouseCapacity - - the maximum capacity of the warehouse, in items
        jobDuration - - the duration of your fixed-term job as warehouse manager, in days
        cleanLedger - - a ledger for recording the daily transactions performed
        Throws:
        WarehouseException - if the warehouse capacity is negative or the job duration is not positive (greater than zero)

    • Method Detail

      • insolvent

        public boolean insolvent()
        Description copied from interface: Transactions
        Returns true if the business is currently insolvent, i.e., if the cash reserve is negative.
        Specified by:
        insolvent in interface Transactions
        Returns:
        true if the ledger says that we are bankrupt, false otherwise

      • orderUnfulfilled

        public boolean orderUnfulfilled()
        Description copied from interface: Transactions
        Returns true if the last order processed, using methods sellStock or restockAndSellStock, was not fulfilled, i.e., if more items were ordered than were in stock at the time. False is returned if no sellStock or restockAndSellStock operations have been performed yet.
        Specified by:
        orderUnfulfilled in interface Transactions
        Returns:
        true if the last order processed was not fulfilled, false otherwise

      • jobDone

        public boolean jobDone()
        Description copied from interface: Transactions
        Returns true if the business simulation has ended because the number of days originally allocated for the job (when this class was constructed) has been exceeded.
        Specified by:
        jobDone in interface Transactions
        Returns:
        true iff the current day in the ledger is greater than the initial duration for the job, false otherwise

      • restockAndSellStock

        public void restockAndSellStock(java.lang.Integer todaysOrder)
                         throws WarehouseException
        Description copied from interface: Transactions
        Complete a day's transactions by (1) restocking the warehouse to capacity, (2) selling the ordered number of items, and (3) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order. (It doesn't matter if the first step temporarily sends the cash reserve into the red, provided the balance is positive at the end of the day.)
        Specified by:
        restockAndSellStock in interface Transactions
        Parameters:
        todaysOrder - the number of items ordered for retail sale today
        Throws:
        WarehouseException - if today's order was negative

      • sellStock

        public void sellStock(java.lang.Integer todaysOrder)
               throws WarehouseException
        Description copied from interface: Transactions
        Complete a day's transactions by (1) selling the ordered number of items, and (2) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order.
        Specified by:
        sellStock in interface Transactions
        Parameters:
        todaysOrder - the number of items ordered for retail sale today
        Throws:
        WarehouseException - if today's order was negative
